title: I want to sample a 25-second audio clip from “The Great Gatsby”, but I do not want to get into legal trouble. What are the laws with sampling movie dialogue into music? - Quora

response.answer_text: U.S. Perspective: Sampling of any audio requires permission. By “sampling”, I mean taking an audio or music clip and putting it into your music. So there is no legal way to do this, except by getting permission. Making music pretty much never fits fair use, so you almost certainly won’t be able to make that claim in your defense if you get sued.
